org.threadly.litesockets

Interface Client.ClientOptions

  • Enclosing class:
    Client

    public static interface Client.ClientOptions
    ClientOptions that can be changed depending on what kind of client you want. In general these should not be set unless you have a very specific use case.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxClientReadBuffer()
      Returns the currently set max Read buffer size in Bytes.
      boolean getNativeBuffers()
      Returns the current state of native buffers.
      int getReadAllocationSize()
      Returns the current Read buffer allocation size in bytes.
      boolean getReducedReadAllocations()
      Returns the current state of ReducedReadAllocations.
      int getSocketRecvBuffer()
      Returns the currently set receive buffer size in bytes.
      int getSocketSendBuffer()
      Returns the currently set send buffer size in bytes.
      boolean getTcpNoDelay()
      Returns the current state of TcpNoDelay.
      int getUdpFrameSize()
      Returns the currently set UDP frame size in bytes.
      boolean setMaxClientReadBuffer(int size)
      Sets the max size of read buffer the client is allowed to have.
      boolean setNativeBuffers(boolean enabled)
      Sets this client to use Native or Direct ByteBuffers.

      Sets the size of the ByteBuffer used for Reads.

      Sets reduced Read buffer allocations.

      This sets the System level socket receive buffer size.

      This sets the System level socket send buffer size.

      This is only available for connection backed by a TCP socket.
      boolean setUdpFrameSize(int size)
      Sets the UDP frame size.

    • Method Detail

      • setTcpNoDelay

        boolean setTcpNoDelay(boolean enabled)
        This is only available for connection backed by a TCP socket. It will turn on TcpNoDelay on the the connection at the System level. This means that data queued to go out the socket will not delay before being sent.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true means NoDelay is on, false means NoDelay is off.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getTcpNoDelay

        boolean getTcpNoDelay()
        Returns the current state of TcpNoDelay.
        Returns:
        true means NoDelay is on, false means NoDelay is off.

      • setNativeBuffers

        boolean setNativeBuffers(boolean enabled)
        Sets this client to use Native or Direct ByteBuffers. This can save allocations to the Heap, but is generally only useful for things like pass through proxies.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true means use Native buffers false means use Heap buffers.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getNativeBuffers

        boolean getNativeBuffers()
        Returns the current state of native buffers.
        Returns:
        true means native buffers are generated false means they are not.

      • setReducedReadAllocations

        boolean setReducedReadAllocations(boolean enabled)
        Sets reduced Read buffer allocations. This is accomplished by over allocating the read buffer and returning subsets of it. This can make reads much faster but does also use more memory.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true for enabled false for disabled.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getReducedReadAllocations

        boolean getReducedReadAllocations()
        Returns the current state of ReducedReadAllocations.
        Returns:
        true for enabled false for disabled.

      • setMaxClientReadBuffer

        boolean setMaxClientReadBuffer(int size)
        Sets the max size of read buffer the client is allowed to have. Once this is reached the client will stop doing read operations until the Read buffers gets under this size. This can really effect performance especially if its set to small.
        Parameters:
        size - in bytes.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getMaxClientReadBuffer

        int getMaxClientReadBuffer()
        Returns the currently set max Read buffer size in Bytes.
        Returns:
        size of max read buffer size.

      • setReadAllocationSize

        boolean setReadAllocationSize(int size)
        Sets the size of the ByteBuffer used for Reads. The larger this buffer is the more data we can read from the socket at once. If getReducedReadAllocations() is true we will reuse the unused space in this buffer until it gets below the minimum read threshold.
        Parameters:
        size - in bytes.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getReadAllocationSize

        int getReadAllocationSize()
        Returns the current Read buffer allocation size in bytes.
        Returns:
        bytes allocated for reads.

      • setSocketSendBuffer

        boolean setSocketSendBuffer(int size)
        This sets the System level socket send buffer size. Every OS has its own min and max values for this, if you go over or under that it will not be set.
        Parameters:
        size - buffer size in bytes.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getSocketSendBuffer

        int getSocketSendBuffer()
        Returns the currently set send buffer size in bytes.
        Returns:
        send buffer size in bytes.

      • setSocketRecvBuffer

        boolean setSocketRecvBuffer(int size)
        This sets the System level socket receive buffer size. Every OS has its own min and max values for this, if you go over or under that it will not be set.
        Parameters:
        size - buffer size in bytes.
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getSocketRecvBuffer

        int getSocketRecvBuffer()
        Returns the currently set receive buffer size in bytes.
        Returns:
        send buffer size in bytes.

      • setUdpFrameSize

        boolean setUdpFrameSize(int size)
        Sets the UDP frame size. This only possible on UDP backed clients.
        Parameters:
        size - max frame size in bytes
        Returns:
        true if this was able to be set.

      • getUdpFrameSize

        int getUdpFrameSize()
        Returns the currently set UDP frame size in bytes.
        Returns:
        frame size in bytes.
